Class PasswordGenerator

java.lang.Object
PasswordGenerator
public class PasswordGenerator extends Object
Class PasswordGenerator. Contains methods required to generate a password based on a provided length from a pool of predefined characters.
Author:
Cailean Bernard

  • Constructor Details

    • PasswordGenerator

      public PasswordGenerator()

  • Method Details

    • savePasswordAsString

      public String savePasswordAsString(String[] array)
      Iterates through a passed array, concatenating the elements into a string.
      Parameters:
      array - - An array of randomized characters.
      Returns:
      String - A String version of the generated password.

    • getRandomElement

      public String getRandomElement()
      Returns a randomly selected character from the selection pools. Concatenates all numbers, special, upper, and lowercase chars into one String and returns one at random.
      Returns:
      String - The randomly selected element that was selected from the pool.

    • getPassLength

      public int getPassLength(Scanner userInput)
      Retrieves a length from the user via keyboard input. Filters out numbers less than/equal to 0 as well as all non-integer input.
      Parameters:
      userInput - - Scanner to accept input via keyboard.
      Returns:
      int - The password length that will be used in generation.

    • fillArray

      public void fillArray(String[] array)
      Iterates over a passed array and sets each index to a random character by calling getRandomElement().
      Parameters:
      array - - The array to be filled with random characters.

    • generatePassword

      public String generatePassword(Scanner userInput)
      Generates a new password. Calls all methods in PasswordGenerator class to retrieve a password length from user, create a new array with that length, fill the array with random characters, and return a String representation of the generated password to the user.
      Parameters:
      userInput - - Scanner to accept input via keyboard.
      Returns:
      String - String representation of the generated password.

    • goAgain

      public boolean goAgain(Scanner userInput)
      Prompts the user to generate another password. If they enter Y or y, the program restarts. If they enter anything else, the program exits.
      Parameters:
      userInput - - Scanner to accept input via keyboard.
      Returns:
      boolean - If true, the program will run again. If false, exits.
